text: Hi everyone. I'm wondering, is there a way to define custom functions or filters in hubl? See here for more details: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/CMS-Development/Is-it-possible-to-write-or-simulate-custom-functions-in-hubl/td-p/749566>

Hello sir <@U01QVR44MEY>, I have page here below with "required password" option  to pull a deal content, is it possible to display deal associated with the contact login after logging in success sir ?

I tried to use this code as sample to get some result after password protected page login

```{% set contact_deals = crm_associations(contact.hs_object_id, 'HubSpot_DEFINED', 4, "", 'dealname,amount,dealstage,createdate,closedate') %}
{{contact_deals}}```
I get error when put that code in the module sir see image below:
To think the the page is already has password-restricted already why its still got error something like this sir.

Hi,  I’m working on a new Search Results page for our HubSpot website. When I display the search results, it’s easy to show a blog post date.  How do I show a landing page or website published date in my results?
It is just a warning, you should be able to do what you need anyway. I get that same warning on a template used for a membership page and I'm using crm_associations as well, it works fine.

Unfortunately not working sir. see image attached I cant even publish the page when insert that code neeed to resolve 1 issue which is "CONTACT objects can only be retrieved on membership or password-restricted pages"
Oh ok, now I see. In that case I think you should have a look at the "crm object" and/or "crm object property" fields available in custom modules (click on "Add field" on the right).
You mean this one sir ? Still error appear sir
<@U049YGVBGBC> Thanks for helping!
I would reload the design manager page
You have the error "Internal Error" and then you have that warning
I still have the Internal error warning sir I reload the design manager already many times
Do you have the error or the warning
hello sir <@U01QVR44MEY> I think the error comes the page is using "Booya: Authentication" does this one of the reason sir ?
I really don't think that has anything to do with it
can you show the waring message again after you reloaded the page?
also instead of "request.contact.contactvid" just use "contact.hs_object_id"

Yes sir I tried to paste your code before
no error but when to see the page result no output is being showed sir.
```{% set contact_deals = crm_associations(contact.hs_object_id, 'HubSpot_DEFINED', 4, "", 'dealname,amount,dealstage,createdate,closedate') %}
{{contact_deals}}```
Is it because the page I am working is using dynamic source sir ?

What I am trying to achieve sir is I want to display deals associated with the contact using the "dynamic pages using CRM objects"

here's the running code I was working sir but I cant display the deal which is associated to my only deal and associated company deal sir

here's the code sir

```    {% set deal = crm_objects(dynamic_page_crm_object_type_fqn,  "pipeline=default&limit=200","hs_object_id, amount, dealname, HubSpot_owner_id, dealstage, createdate, closedate, company, hs_all_collaborator_owner_ids") %}
     ```
Hello guys, any idea here how to use dynamic_page_crm_object  is it possible to use *crm_associations* rather than *CRN_OBJECTS* ?
Oh sorry didn't realize this was for a dynamic page, where are you getting the contact id from?
Is this for a member page? where the contact needs to be logged in?
Btw sir this is for dynamic page actually the deal right now is working.

Right now I don't think we have a member page because it require to make the HubSpot account enterprise . Right now we have a password protected page on advance menu sir.  Don't know how to associate the deals to the contact since there is no login in form before entering right ?
Yes, so you can really only look up the contact if its on a membership page where the contact is logged in

So in this case sir displaying associated deals using dynamic page is not working on our side ?  btw whats the use of password thing there sir. nothing relative in displaying the deals associated on the contact right >?
correct that won't affect anything connected with the contact
You can display all deal but not really those associated with a contact id
because you don't know the contact id yet

Got it . I was able to display the deals only and even filter to pipeline. but not the associated one. I will definitely tell this to my partner we decide if she will upgrade to enterprise :see_no_evil: which is too much expensive
Sounds goood

Is there any alternative login form to the site sir inorder to know the contact ID.  I remember yesterday my partner did give me a page where I will logged in as alternative and have a profile page too see image below sir.  I think it was the BOoya sir
You could have them use an email address to filter the deals
Do you mean we can still get the deal associated contact on the page with only password protected sir ? can you give me a reference link to read sir about filter the email address
You could have a simple text input that would allow the user to filter by the value in the input
don't have the docs on it
<https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tutorials/crm-data-for-cms-pages>
If the page is a membership page do it normally if not get the email from the input box
This code would need to be edited slightly to make the work
So the email they input will need to be the same as the one loggedin from the HubSpot inorder to read their associated deals right ?
No, they wouldn't be loggedin because it's not a membership page
Does the sample code above will be inputed inside the Dynamic page code sir or is it separately ?
Sir just wonder on the docs where can we locate the "Request contact" and "Specified Contact Email" settings
I would think you could use crm_associations on a dynamic page using the record id? Following this thread for the answer :slightly_smiling_face:

Having some issue with coding a module - using a `Color field` named `name_title_color` and I'm attempting to reference the color and opacity within a css class like so:
`.testimonial-name {`
  `color: {{module.name_title_color.value}};`
  `opacity: {{ module.name_title_color.opacity / 100}};`
  `font-weight:600;`
  `margin-bottom:5px;`
`}`
Nothing is being rendered though.   Any ideas?
are you sure ts name_title_color.value
i think its name_title_color.color
lemme look in my fields
yeah try switching it to .color
Yea tried that.  If I inline css the value, it works, but not when Im adding it to a class in css
`<div class="testimonial-text" style="color:{{module.quote_color.color }}">` works but not the other way
Very odd.
You managed to get it within the module.css classes?
<@U04GE91SXQA>
I didn’t use that in modules that’s how I set up my css from my theme fields.js

like so
`h1,`
`.h1 {`
  `{{ theme.typography.headings.desktop.style }};`
  `_font-size_: {{ theme.typography.headings.h1.desktop.size ~ theme.typography.headings.h1.desktop.size_unit }};`
I think its similar for modules

<@U04HSBLHAJZ> You can’t put hubl inside the css pane, so if you want to use css like that, you could put in in the module / html / hubl section like this: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/building-blocks/modules/files#require-css-block>

```{% require_css %}
.testimonial-name {
  color: {{module.name_title_color.color }};
  opacity: {{ module.name_title_color.opacity / 100}};
  font-weight:600;
  margin-bottom:5px;
}
{% end_require_css %}```

I think a better way to implement that is to change colors to classnames, and just do if statements and add the class for the color — now if you are giving people a color picker, then that just means they can create whatever color they want in there and turn the page into some psychedelic nightmare. If that is an absolute must have for the client, instead of sticking to branding colors and doing a select dropdown for them and assigning colors to classes, then I’d just inline style it vs adding another style tag…because performance would likely be better.

I’m not sure if you can create pages based off associations, but I haven’t tried to do that yet.

You should be able to query using `crm_associations()`

Overall I believe the dynamic pages are using the objects as the “detail” page. They don’t have child pages and the such…

So if you wanted to utilize assocaited objects, I think they would be more of a setup like this;

Dynamic object is a “product”, containing some meta details, pictures of the product, etc.

Associated objects are “review”, “specs”, “warranty”

So you would then query those associated objects and display that information on the product page.

Now — with HubDb you can use child tables and parent tables, so you could create pages like /dynamic-listing/dynamic-page/child-page
that is only a warning, it won’t prevent you from saving/publishing…
because you are editing a module, it doesn’t have the context of what page it is on…
Thanks for all the input everyone!
